intro: Alchemilla rutenbergii var. iratsyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar rockfoil, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bright green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellowish-white flowers in late spring, which are clustered in umbels. This species is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
